intro: Litsea striolata, commonly known as the streaked litsea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, including countries such as Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves, which have a distinctive striated pattern on their upper surface. It produces small, yellowish-white flowers followed by elliptical, woody fruits. Litsea striolata is often found in lowland and hill forest areas, thriving in humid and shaded environments.
